creator: sudipa.bhattacharya@sun.com
text:
It seems that "fixcrlf" task fails on Windows XP while renaming files created under "Temp" dir.

Versions used:
OS: Windows XP 2002 SP2
Ant 1.6.5

The way the task fixcrlf is being used is :

<fixcrlf srcdir="${my.archive.dir1}/lib"  includes="*.html"  eol="lf" />

The way it fails during execution is usually as follows :
C:\runbox\2008-02-12\1\tomcat\appserver-sqe\pe\tomcat\jspc\common_build.xml:85:
java.io.IOException: Failed to delete C:\runbox\2008-02-12\1\tomcat\appserver-sqe\build\pe\x86_JED-ASQE-42_Windows_NT\tomcat-jspc\archive\jspc\webapp1\lib\test02a.html  while trying to rename C:\DOCUME~1\j2eetest\LOCALS~1\Temp\fixcrlf411778120

I could not find any issue filed on this topic . But however, I found a thread in mailing list archive reported quite some time back as :
http://marc.info/?l=ant-user&w=2&r=1&s=fixcrlf++IOException&q=b

If any solution is already available, please let me know how can I obtain that .

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
Is there any other process that could be holding a lock on test02a.html?  Has Ant ever touched that file?

If your case is the same as reported on the mailing list (i.e. a race condition because Ant has just recently opened and closed the file) then this issue should be fixed by the fix for bug 45960.

You could download a source snapshot for ant trunk, bootstrap it and check whether you problem has been fixed by now to verify it really is the same problem as reported on list.

creator: sudipa.bhattacharya@sun.com
text:
Thanks for your response on this issue.
It seems to me that the issue reported in bug 45960 is same as that of mine.

And to answer your query : No, test02.html is not locked by any other process at that point. This is a pattern seen intermittently while executing "fixcrlf" on a set of files in a particular directory.

I am downloading a snapshot of trunk build.
I will update with my observation with that .

text:

# ant -version

error running fixcrlf on file C:\runbox\.....\test.html

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
If it is not Ant who is holding locks on the HTML files, then the changes in trunk won't help.

Ant's trunk should work fine with Java 1.4 (that's what one of my development environment uses), do you recall what kind of error message you received?

Can you give us the full error message of your new error (-verbose might help as well)?

creator: jkf@apache.org
text: Needing information for more than 4 years, closing. If the problem still exists, please re-open this report with the requested information.
